name: 技職教育教學法專題研究
goals: 了解技職教育各教學方法
了解技職教育各教學方法的優劣勢
如何選擇有效教學法應用於教學
syllabus:
Class time: Tue. C & D (8:30-10:15 pm)

Classroom: Seminar I 研討一

Pre-requisite: Students are expected to have completed coursework on educational psychology or related courses. If not, students are encouraged to study relevant theories before class.

Schedule:

1.  9/6 Course introduction
2.  9/13 Review of fundamental learning theories
3.  9/20 Review of fundamental learning theories
4.  9/27 Behaviorism and constructivism in instruction in CTE
5.  10/4 Behaviorism and constructivism in instruction in CTE
6.  10/11 Social cognitive theory in instruction in CTE
7.  10/18 Social cognitive theory in instruction in CTE
8.  10/25 (Midterm)
9.  11/1 Multimedia learning and instruction: Theory and practice in CTE
10.  11/8 Multimedia learning and instruction: Theory and practice in CTE
11.  11/15 Game-based learning: Theory and practice in CTE
12.  11/22 Game-based learning: Theory and practice in CTE
13.  11/29 Project-, problem-, and inquiry-based learning in CTE
14.  12/6 Project-, problem-, and inquiry-based learning in CTE
15.  12/13 Self-regulated learning in CTE: Theory and practice
16.  12/20 Self-regulated learning in CTE: Theory and practice; final words

The syllabus is tentative and subject to change.

grading.note: Students are expected to post a summary of the required readings and propose questions for in-class discussion.

Students are required to draft a literature critique over a topic that has been or will be covered in class. Details of the requirements will be discussed in class. Deadline: 10:30 pm, Oct. 25th. No late assignments will be accepted unless an extension has been granted before the deadline.
Students are expected to participate in discussion in class.

Each student will choose a topic from the syllabus and do a presentation. The presentation should summarize the required readings of the topic and respond to the questions proposed by each student. The presentation should be no more than 30-minute long.
Based on the midterm paper, students will expand the scope of the paper and respond to the review comments. Deadline: 10:30 pm, Dec. 27th.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
